quotes.quote: A bachelor is a guy who never made the same mistake once
A married man has many cares, but a bachelor no pleasures.
A bachelor's life is a fine breakfast, a flat lunch, and a miserable dinner.
A married man is a man with a past, while a bachelor is a man with a future.
A bachelor is a man who comes to work each morning from a different direction.
A bachelor is a guy who leans toward women - but not far enough to lose his balance.
Bachelors know more about women than married men; if they didn't they'd be married too.
A bachelor gets tangled up with a lot of women in order to avoid getting tied up to one.
A Bachelor of Arts is one who makes love to a lot of women, and yet has the art to remain a bachelor.
To the bachelor, the language of women is mystery. In those matters, a married man is already a scholar.
The bachelors admired freedom is often a yoke, for the freer a man is to himself the greater slave he often is to the whims of others.
A bachelor May thrive by observation on a little, A single life's no burthen: but to draw In yokes is chargeable, and will require A double maintenance.

People always assume that bachelors are single by choice and spinsters because nobody asked them. It never enters their heads that poor bachelors might have worn the knees of their trousers out proposing to girls who rejected them or that a girl might deliberately stay unmarried.
A bachelor is only half a man.
A bachelor's bed is the most pleasant.
A bachelor never quite gets over the idea that he is a thing of beauty and a boy forever.
A bachelor has to have inspiration for making love to a woman, a married man needs only an excuse.
Bachelors alone can travel freely, and without any twinges of their consciences touching desertion of the fire-side.
